greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n times the number of 1's in the binary expansion of n.
link: Jens Kruse Andersen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f.: x * (d/dx) (1/(1 - x))*Sum_{k>=0} x^(2^k)/(1 + x^(2^k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Mar 27 2018
program: (Python) [n*bin(n)[2:].count('1') for n in range(1000)] # _Chai Wah Wu_, Aug 03 2014
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, n * sumdigits(n, 2))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Aug 05 2014 */ /* since version 2.6.0 */
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Aug 01 2014
